intro: Cnicus sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is an annual or biennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features lobed, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers with five petals. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats. Botanically, it belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
